title: Colwick Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Walking in Colwick Country Park
images.caption: The park was created largely on the site of old gravel extraction workings.

images.caption: In Colwick Country Park, looking towards Colwick Hall

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Model boaters - steam and sail
images.caption: Model boaters - steam and sail. The gentleman on the path has a fine steam-driver cutter on his stand.

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Walking in Colwick Country Park
images.caption: Dog Walking in Colwick Country Park

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Walled Garden, Colwick Hall.
images.caption: Walled Garden, Colwick Hall. This stands some distance from the Hall, but was presumably the kitchen garden, although it is D-shaped rather than the traditional rectangle.

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Great Crested Grebe in Colwick Country Park
images.caption: Great Crested Grebe on the water.

description: Enjoy several miles of lovely, waterside walking and cycling in this country park in Nottingham.  The park contains two large lakes, a marina, woodland and meadows.  The River Trent also runs through the park so there is scope for continuing your walk along the Trent Valley Way walking route. There is also an excellent visitor centre with cycle hire available. To extend your exercise you could visit the nearby Holme Pierrepont Country Park where there are more good cycling and walking trails. You could also head to Broxtowe Country Park where there's some nice woodland trails and a BMX track to try. The park is located to the south of Nottingham city centre near to Nottingham Midland Railway station.
